Question: the sentence that is closest in meaning to each of the following questions. “I agree that I am narrow–minded,” said the manager.

Answer.content: The manager refused to be narrow–minded.
The manager promised to be narrow–minded.

Question: the sentence that is closest in meaning to each of the following questions. A supermarket is more convenient than a shopping centre.

Answer.content: A shopping centre is not as convenient as a supermarket.
A shopping centre is more convenient than a supermarket.
A supermarket is not as convenient as a shopping centre.
A supermarket is as inconvenient as a shopping centre.

Question: the sentence that is closest in meaning to each of the following questions.It was a mistake for Tony to buy that house.

Answer.content: Tony shouldn’t have bought that house.
Tony couldn’t have bought that house.
Tony can’t have bought that house.
Tony needn’t have bought that house.

Question: the sentence that best combines each pair of sentences in the following questions. Julian dropped out of college after his first year. Now he regrets it.

Answer.content: If only Julian hadn’t dropped out of college after his first year.
Julian regrets not having dropped out of college after his first year.
Julian wishes he didn’t drop out of college after his first year.
Only if Julian had dropped out of college after his first year would he not regret it.

Question: the sentence that best combines each pair of sentences in the following questions.Seth informed us of his retirement from the company. He did it when arriving at the meeting.

Answer.content: No sooner had Seth arrived at the meeting than we were told about his leaving the company.
. Only after his retiring from the company did Seth tell us about his arrival at the meeting.
Hardly had Seth notified us of his retiring from the company when he arrived at the meeting.

Question: “You'd better stay at home during this time,” he said to Lan.

Answer.content: He advised Lan to stay at home during that time.
He ordered Lan to stay at home during that time.
He warned Lan against staying at home during that time.
He thanked Lan for staying at home during that time.

Question: You are not allowed to take photos in the museum.

Answer.content: You mustn't take photos in the museum.
You may take photos in the museum.
You should take photos in the museum.
You needn't take photos in the museum.

Question: The film is not perfect. Its abrupt ending spoils it.

Answer.content: But for its abrupt ending, the film would be perfect.
The film would be perfect if it ended abruptly.
Provided the film ended abruptly, it would not be perfect.
Unless the film ends abruptly, it won't be perfect.

Question: Olga handed in her exam paper. She then realised that she had missed one question.

Answer.content: Not until Olga had handed in her exam paper did she realise that she had missed one question.
. Having realised that she had missed one question, Olga handed in her exam paper.
Had Olga realised that she had missed one question, she wouldn't hand in her exam paper.
Only after Olga realised that she had missed one question did she hand in her exam paper.

Question: “I went out with my friends last night,” Tim said.

Answer.content: Time said that he had gone out with his friends the previous night.
Time said that I had gone out with his friends last night.
Tim said that I would go out with his friends last night.
Tim said that he went out with my friends the previous night.

Question: Perhaps we will be late for the meeting.

Answer.content: We may not get to the meeting on time.
We must get to the meeting on time.
We should get to the meeting on time.
We needn’t get to the meeting on time.

Question: You can use my car. Make sure you bring it back by 7 p.m.

Answer.content: You can use my car provided you bring it back by 7 p.m.
You can’t use my car in case you forget to bring it back by 7 p.m.
You can’t use my car if you bring it back by 7 p.m.
You can use my car unless you bring it back by 7 p.m.

Question: The #Trashtag Challenge has had a great influence on people around the world. They have started to clean up their nearby polluted areas.

Answer.content: So influential is the #Trashtag Challenge that people around the world would they start cleaning up their nearby polluted areas.
Only if the #Trashtag Challenge greatly influenced people around the world have started to clean up their nearby polluted areas.
Not until people around the world had started cleaning up their nearby polluted areas did the #Trashtag Challenge greatly influence them.
But for the great influence of the #Trashtag Challenge, people around the world would have started cleaning up their nearby polluted areas.
